TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowRuntimeSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Represents a section, within a configuration file, that defines settings for the workflow run-time engine.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection> contains settings specified by a <`section`> of type <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection> in a configuration file. The settings specified in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection> are used to initialize the workflow run-time engine. Your application can call the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.%23ctor%28System.String%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor to initialize the workflow run-time engine from the appropriately named section of the configuration file.
If your application does not use configuration files, but you still want to initialize the workflow run-time engine from a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection> you can configure a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection> in your application and call the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.%23ctor%28System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor. For example, your application might store configuration parameters in a database or it might operate in a trusted environment where configuration files are not used

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CommonParameters As NameValueConfigurationCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of common parameters used by services.
Docs.value: The common parameters used by services. The default is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeSection.CommonParameters%2A> can contain, for example, a database connection string that might be shared by durable services.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnablePerformanceCounters { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.EnablePerformanceCounters : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether performance counters are enabled.
Docs.value: if performance counters are enabled; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Performance counters provide information on various workflow-related statistics, but they cause a performance penalty when the workflow run-time engine starts and when workflow instances are running. The default value is `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the workflow run-time engine.
Docs.value: The name of the workflow run-time engine.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.Name%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. The default is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Services As WorkflowRuntimeServiceElementCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of services that are added to the workflow run-time engine when it is initialized.
Docs.value: The services to be added to the workflow run-time engine.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The services specified in the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElementCollection> are initialized by the workflow run-time engine and added to its services when the appropriate <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> constructor is called. Therefore the services specified in the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElementCollection> must follow certain rules about the signatures of their constructors. For more information, see <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElement>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ValidateOnCreate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ValidateOnCreate : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether validation occurs on the creation of the workflow instance.
Docs.value: if validation occurs on creation; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this property is set to `true`, the workflow validation is executed every time <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> is called. If validation errors are found, a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.WorkflowValidationFailedException> is thrown.
When this property is set to `false`, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> creates a workflow instance and skips validation. In this case, the host application must guarantee that the workflow is properly configured or the runtime error occurs.
The default value for this property is `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int WorkflowDefinitionCacheCapacity { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.WorkflowDefinitionCacheCapacity : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets the number of workflow definitions that can be cached by the runtime.
